(6:54 AM ET) NEW YORK (CBS.MW) -- Reynolds and Reynolds REY, +0.95% reported fiscal first-quarter earnings of $21 million, or 33 cents a share, down from $24 million, or 34 cents a share in the year-earlier period, but above the average analyst estimate compiled by Thomson First Call of 26 cents but in line with the company's raised outlook provided on Dec. 29. Revenue fell 4 percent to $239.3 million from last year's $248.4 million, amid a 3 percent decline in its software business, a 5 percent drop in its documents business and an 18 percent slide in its financial services business. For fiscal 2005, the automotive retailer services provider expects to earn $1.37 to $1.45 a share, above analyst projections of $1.31 a share. The stock closed Wednesday down 14 cents at $26.30. Student Loan Corp Q4 net income, loan assets up (6:38 AM ET) LONDON (CBS.MW) -- The Student Loan Corporation STU, -0.36% said net income for the fourth quarter rose 37 percent to $72.7 million due to improved net interest margins and a $8 million after-tax gain from securitizing around $1.5 billion of Federal Consolidation Loans last November. It said student loan assets increased 7 percent to $24.9 billion in 2004. Continental posts $206M net loss in Q4; revenue up 6.6% (6:37 AM ET) WASHINGTON (CBS.MW) -- Continental Airlines Inc. CAL, -2.08% posted a fourth-quarter net loss of $206 million, or $3.12 per share, a reversal from net income of $47 million, or 61 cents per share, generated in the final three quarters of 2003. Excluding special items, Continental's loss amounted to $174 million, or $2.62 per share. The carrier's quarterly revenue reached nearly $2.4 million, up 6.6 percent from the prior year's $2.25 billion. Analysts surveyed by Thomson First Call had been looking for Continental to record a loss of $3.29 per share on revenue of nearly $2.31 billion. The company said that it ended 2004 with about $1.46 billion in unrestricted cash and short-term investments and that it continues to talk with labor groups about reductions in pay and benefits. Shares of Continental slipped 40 cents to end at $9.45 in Wednesday's trading. Charlotte Russe's Q1 profit off as comps turn negative (6:33 AM ET) WASHINGTON (CBS.MW) -- Charlotte Russe Holding Inc. CHIC posted earnings of $1.62 million, or 7 cents per share, for the first quarter ended Dec. 25, down from $6.57 million, or 28 cents, earned in the same period a year earlier. The women's apparel retailer came in with first-quarter sales of $149.98 million, up marginally from the prior year's $149.29 million. Analysts polled by Thomson First Call had expected Charlotte Russe to earn 8 cents per share on sales of $156 million. CEO Mark Hoffman said "we were very disappointed" that the latest quarter's comparable-store sales dropped 9.9 percent. The company also scaled back its full-year plans for store openings, to 50 from 60 previously. Shares of Charlotte Russe added 9 cents to end at $10.10 in Wednesday's trading. Citigroup Q4 beats a penny and lifts payout (6:27 AM ET) NEW YORK (CBS.MW) -- Citigroup, C, +0.31% the New York international financial services group, reported better-than expected fourth-quarter earnings on growth in businesses includng retail banking and consumer finance, 5 percent higher revenue at the Smith Barney investment bank, and a "strong" international performance. Fourth-quarter net income rose to $5.32 billion, or $1.02 a share, up 12 percent from the year-earlier period. Thomson First Call's consensus analyst estimate was $1.01 a share. The earnings reflect a $244 million after-tax charge to close the Japan Private Bank and a $131 million after-tax reserve related to expected resolution of a Securities and Exchange Commission investigation of transfer agent matters. Citigroup shares fell 13 cents, or 0.3 percent, Wednesday to $48.04. Powell Ind. asks for 15-day 10-K extension (6:26 AM ET) LONDON (CBS.MW) -- Powell Industries, Inc. POWL, +1.08% said it has requested a 15-day delay for the filing of its 10-K annual report to the Securities and Exchange Commission. The electrical energy equipment specialist said that the correction of two lease overstatements would boost fiscal 2004 net income by approximately $240,000. Knight Q4 rev. higher as fees rose, rev. per trade flat (6:19 AM ET) LONDON (CBS.MW) -- Nasdaq market maker Knight Trading Group NITE, -9.89% saying market conditions improved after a flat summer, posted an 8.7 percent rise in revenue for the fourth quarter to $185.6 million. A rise in asset management fees helped offset a decline in revenue in Equity Markets. Income from continuing operations in asset management and equity markets declined to 20 cents a share from 22 cents in the year-ago period. "Equity Markets benefited from significant increases in both daily dollar volumes and trade volumes, although revenue capture remained at third quarter levels in the midst of a very competitive environment," Knight said. SunTrust Banks Q4 net rises to $455.7M vs. $342.5M (6:13 AM ET) LONDON (CBS.MW) -- SunTrust Banks STI, -2.88% said net income for the fourth quarter was $455.7 million, up from $342.5 million in the year-earlier quarter. Net income per diluted share was $1.26, up 4 percent from $1.21 per diluted share in the fourth quarter of 2003. "Our fourth-quarter results benefited from a continuation of positive trends from earlier in the year, notably increasingly robust revenue growth, excellent credit quality and more effective cost control," said CEO Phillip Humann. UnitedHealth's Q4 net earnings rise 46% (6:10 AM ET) WASHINGTON (CBS.MW) -- UnitedHealth Group UNH, +1.50% posted fourth-quarter earnings of $739 million, or $1.09 per share, up from $507 million, or 83 cents, earned in the final three months of 2003. The health-care services provider's quarterly revenue reached $10.51 billion from the prior year's $7.52 billion. According to Thomson First Call, analysts' average estimates were for quarterly earnings of $1.08 per share on revenue of $10.36 billion. The company also increased its 2005 profit outlook to a range of $4.75 to $4.80 per share, 5 cents higher than previously forecast. Shares of UnitedHealth slipped 52 cents to end at $88.28 in Wednesday's trading. Creative Q2 profits fall, sales jump 50% on iPod rival (4:58 AM ET) LONDON (CBS.MW) -- Creative Technology CREAF, -2.98% the Singapore-based MP3 player maker, said fiscal second quarter ending Dec. 31 profit fell to $11.8 million, or 14 cents a share, against $41.5 million, or 50 cents a share, while sales rose 50 percent to $375 million. It's anticipating a 50 percent year-on-year sales growth in the third quarter as well, with gross margins around 27 percent. Creative said it sold two million of its MP3 players, a product that's a rival to Apple Computer's AAPL, -0.66% iPod, in the quarter. "I believe we are extremely well positioned against the flash products and pricing that were recently announced by Apple, as we have superior features and broad product lines that span the entire category. I also believe that Apple's entry into the flash market will create more awareness in the flash market segment, and we are well positioned to become a big beneficiary of this expanding market," said Sim Wong Hoo, chairman and CEO. D.R. Horton Q1 profits up more than sales, ups FY view (4:38 AM ET) LONDON (CBS.MW) -- Home builder D.R. Horton DHI, -3.49% said fiscal first quarter net income rose 30 percent to $241 million, or $1.01 a share, with revenue up 14 percent to $2.5 billion. Analysts were expecting an EPS of 93 cents on revenue of $2.63 billion, according to Thomson First Call. Homes closed in the quarter rose 5 percent to 9.680 homes. It sees EPS in the March 31-ending quarter to be in a $1 to $1.05 range and has upped its fiscal year 2005 guidance to a $4.75 to $4.90 range, on expected revenue of more than $12.5 billion; analysts had anticipated an EPS of $4.74 on revenue of $12.69 billion. Update:LVMH shares 3% lower after downbeat 2005 outlook (3:18 AM ET) LONDON (CBS.MW) -- Luxury goods group LVMH(FR:012101)shares fell 2.7 percent to 53.75 euros in early French trade after it said overnight the "economic and exchange rate environment is likely to remain challenging" in 2005. It said sales grew 6 percent to 12.6 billion euros in 2004, which it said it achieved in a "very difficult exchange rate environment" in which both the dollar and the yen both weakened further against the euro. Estimated operating income grew 10 percent in 2004, on top of a 9 percent growth in 2003. It set the goal of a "tangible increase in operating income" in 2005. (Updates with year of 6 percent sales growth and operating profit details.) Umbro sees 05 profit hit as Chelsea Club deal ends (2:22 AM ET) LONDON (CBS.MW) -- Branded sporting goods maker Umbro(UK:UMB)warned pre-tax profits are expected to decline by 1 million to 2 million pounds due to the early end of a sponsorship deal with U.K. soccer organization, the Chelsea Football Club. The Club is owned by Russian billionaire Roman Abramovich. Umbro, which gave no reason for the early termination, said it will receive a 24.5 million pound payment from Chelsea for the from June 2006 to 2011 period. In 2004, sales of Chelsea product of 8.2 million represented 6.1 percent of Umbro's UK turnover and 2.3 percent of Group Total Wholesale Equivalent Sales, it said. Schneider Elec. Q4 sales up, reiterates FY '05 forecast (2:21 AM ET) LONDON (CBS.MW) -- Schneider Electric(FR:01297), the French electrical products group, Thursday said fourth-quarter sales were up 7.9 percent to 2.737 billion euros ($3.56 billion) on a constant structure and exchange rate basis. Schneider Electric also reiterated its forecast for organic sales growth of 5 percent to 6 percent in fiscal 2005. Novartis '04 earns up 15%, sees record sales in 2005 (2:16 AM ET) LONDON (CBS.MW) -- Swiss pharmaceuticals maker Novartis NVS, -1.56% said net income for 2004 rose 15 percent to $5.8 billion, with both the Pharmaceuticals and Consumer Health divisions growing at double-digit rates in U.S. dollars. Net sales rose 9 percent at constant currencies to $28.3 billion. In the fourth quarter, net sales rose 13 percent to $7.6 billion and net income rose 1 percent. It said its outlook for 2005 remains strong with record sales expected. "Barring any unforeseen events, group operating and net income should reach new record levels on a comparable basis (in 2005)," Novartis said. Novartis also said it has 75 projects in clinical development, which includes 52 in phase II, III or registration. It has 64 candidates in advanced pre-clinical testing. It invested $3.5 billion in pharmaceutical research and development in 2004. More from MarketWatch What Picking Up an Apple Tells You About the Future of Robotics More Coverage Why tax refunds have lost their sparkle My husband sold his grandmother’s house and paid off our mortgage — now his family is threatening to sue Don’t ever do this with your credit card Related Topics Earnings Markets U.S. Stocks
title: Updates, advisories and surprises

content: SAN FRANCISCO (CBS.MW) -- Oriental Financial Group OFG, +1.44% on Thursday reported second-quarter earnings of $18.5 million, or 69 cents per share, up from $15.7 million, or 64 cents per share, a year ago. Net interest income for the quarter was $22 million, compared with $21.9 million in 2003.
title: Oriental Financial Group Q2 earns up 18%

content: NEW YORK (CBS.MW) -- Oriental Financial Group Inc. OFG, +1.44% named Jose Rafael Fernandez president and chief executive officer. He succeeds Chairman Jose Enrique Fernandez in both positions. The executives aren't related, the company noted. Jose Rafael Fernandez has served as senior executive vice president and chief operating officer with the company since 2003 and has been with the bank since 1991. The stock closed Friday at $30.58, down 1.4 percent.
title: Oriental Financial names Jose R. Fernandez pres., CEO

content: HMN Financial Q3 net income falls 16.1% (11:54 PM ET) SAN FRANCISCO (CBS.MW) -- HMN Financial HMNF said late Thursday that its third-quarter net income fell 16.1 percent to $2.6 million, or 64 cents a share, from $3 million, or 76 cents a year ago. Net interest income in the quarter was $7.8 million vs. $11.5 million a year earlier. Circor Intl Q3 net declines (7:25 PM ET) SAN FRANCISCO (CBS.MW) -- Industrial equipment maker Circor International Inc. CIR said its third-quarter net income fell to $3.3 million, or 21 cents a share, from $4.4 million, or 28 cents a share, in the year-ago period. The company said higher raw material costs, among other factors, led to the decline. Revenue rose 4 percent to $89.8 million. Excluding special items, Circor expects a fourth-quarter profit from operations in the range of 28 cents a share to 32 cents a share. Universal Health Services Q3 earns drop 23% (6:45 PM ET) SAN FRANCISCO (CBS.MW) -- Universal Health Services UHS late Thursday reported third-quarter earnings of $37.8 million, or 62 cents a share, compared with $49.1 million, or 79 cents a share. It said earnings from continuing operations were 63 cents a share. Revenue for the hospital operator was $1.01 billion, up from $871.5 million a year ago. Analysts surveyed by Thomson First Call were expecting earnings of 68 cents a share on revenue of $1.02 billion. Fiserv Q3 earns up 15% (6:42 PM ET) SAN FRANCISCO (CBS.MW) -- Fiserv Inc. FISV late Thursday reported third-quarter earnings of $92.4 million, or 47 cents a share, compared with $80.4 million, or 41 cents a share, last year. The Brookfield, Wisc.-based check processor said sales were $958.1 million, up from $786 million a year ago. Analysts surveyed by Thomson First Call were expecting earnings of 41 cents a share on sales of $870 million. Fiserv forecast 2004 earnings of $1.90 to $1.92 a share. Lattice Semiconductor narrows Q3 loss as sales rise (6:39 PM ET) SAN FRANCISCO (CBS.MW) -- Lattice Semiconductor LSCC late Thursday reported a third-quarter loss of $6.3 million, or 6 cents a share, narrower than last year's loss of $28.7 million, or 26 cents a share. Excluding items, the company reported breakeven per-share results -- matching the Thomson First Call estimate. Revenue totaled $57.3 million, up from $43 million. The company expects fourth-quarter sales of $51 million to $53 million. Ryerson Tull swings to profit in Q3 (6:13 PM ET) SAN FRANCISCO (CBS.MW) -- Ryerson Tull RT said late Thursday it swung to profit in the third quarter on strong market demand. The metals distributor said earnings for the quarter were $17.4 million, or 68 cents a share. Last year the company reported a loss of $3.2 million, or 13 cents a share. Net sales for the quarter were $898.7 million vs. $794.7 million a year earlier. Emulex shares rise as Q1 earns beat Street target (6:07 PM ET) SAN FRANCISCO (CBS.MW) -- Emulex Corp. ELX shares rose 3 percent late Thursday, after reporting first-quarter earnings above Wall Street's outlook. The company posted earnings of $14.3 million, or 17 cents per share, lower than $23.6 million, or 27 cents per share, a year ago. On a pro-forma basis, Emulex earnings were 11 cents per share. Revenue for the quarter was $73.2 million, compared with $85 million in 2003. Analysts polled by Thomson First Call forecast pro forma earnings of 10 cents per share, on revenue of $75 million. Emulex expects to report second-quarter earnings of 8 cents to 10 cents per share, on revenue of $81 million $85 million. PDF Solutions gives Q4, Q1 outlook (5:52 PM ET) SAN FRANCISCO (CBS.MW) -- PDF Solutions PDFS late Thursday forecast fourth-quarter earnings of $1.1 million to $1.6 million, or 4 cents to 6 cents per share, on revenue of $17.7 million to $18.5 million. Analysts polled by Thomson First Call estimate fourth-quarter earnings of 9 cents per share, on revenue of $18 million. The company expects to report first-quarter earnings of $1.3 million to $1.8 million, or 5 cents to 7 cents per share, on revenue of $18 million to $18.8 million. Mentor Graphics Q4 outlook below Street estimates (5:51 PM ET) SAN FRANCISCO (CBS.MW) -- Mentor Graphics MENT said late Thursday that it expects fourth-quarter earnings of 33 cents a share, or 38 cents a share on a pro-forma basis. The company forecasts revenue of $205 million. Analysts, according to Thomson First Call, expected fourth-quarter earnings of 47 cents a share and revenue of $213 million. Mentor said it expects 2005 pro forma earnings of 75 cents to 80 cents a share; analysts expect a profit of 76 cents. Great Plains Energy Q3 earns fall 9%; cuts '04 EPS view (5:49 PM ET) SAN FRANCISCO (CBS.MW) -- Great Plains Energy GXP late Thursday reported third-quarter earnings of $76 million, or $1.02 a share, compared with $83.3 million, or $1.20 a share, last year. The electric energy provider said revenue was $714.9 million, up from $660.8 million a year ago. The company said wholesale utility sales were higher this year, but an unusually cool summer hurt its results. It cut its 2004 earnings forecast to $2.19 to $2.26 a share because of the weather impact on its Kansas City Power & Light unit. Hyperion Solutions shares rise on Q1 results (5:45 PM ET) SAN FRANCISCO (CBS.MW) -- Hyperion Solutions HYSL shares jumped as much as 5 percent late Thursday, after posting a 20 percent rise in first-quarter earnings. Shares of Hyperion traded $1.91 higher to $39.99 in the evening session, after closing up $1.07 to $38.08. The company reported earnings of $11.6 million, or 29 cents per share, up from $9.7 million, or 26 cents per share, a year ago. Revenue for the quarter was $159.5 million, up 29 percent from $123.6 million in 2003. Hyperion forecast second-quarter earnings of 24 cents to 29 cents per share, on revenue of $166 million to $170 million. Crane swings to Q3 loss from asbestos settlement (5:45 PM ET) SAN FRANCISCO (CBS.MW) -- Crane Co. CR swung to third-quarter loss of $205 million, or $3.48 per share, after it recorded a non-cash charge to settle future asbestos claims. The after-tax charge amounts to $238 million, or $4.04 a share. Under the settlement, Crane will pay $280 million in cash to fund a trust for current asbestos claims. Excluding the charge, Crane said it earned $33.2 million, or 56 cents a share. Sales rose 12 percent to $477.3 million. Based in Stamford, Conn., Crane is an aerospace electronics manufacturer and provider of fiberglass panels for trucks and recreational vehicles. Integrated Device Tech Q2 profits up 6.4% (5:33 PM ET) SAN FRANCISCO (CBS.MW) -- Integrated Device Technology IDTI late Thursday reported second-quarter earnings of $8.9 million, or 8 cents per share, up 6.4 percent from $1.2 million, or 1 cent per share, a year ago. Revenue for the quarter was $97 million, compared with $81 million in 2003. Analysts polled by Thomson First Call had forecast earnings of 7 cents per share, on revenue of $98 million. The company also announced that it will buy back up to $50 million of its shares. PeopleSoft Q3 results to help fend off Oracle: analyst (5:31 PM ET) LOS ANGELES (CBS.MW) -- PeopleSoft's PSFT strong third-quarter results posted late Thursday should help support its efforts to remain independent and avoid an acquisition by rival Oracle ORCL Garban Institutional Equities analyst Richard Williams told CBS MarketWatch. "I think coming up with a solid quarter is supportive of the notion of keeping the company independent," Williams said. "This is a necessary step if that's going to happen." Downey Financial agrees to sell $1B of portfolio loans (5:20 PM ET) SAN FRANCISCO (CBS.MW) -- Downey Financial DSL late Thursday said it has agreed to sell $1 billion of its residential loans from its $13.4 billion investment portfolio. The Newport Beach, Calif.-based banking firm said the sale will reduce net interest income until the loans are replaced. It said in about six months its income level should break even as it sees a gain from the sale during the fourth quarter. After the initial six-month period, Downey Financial said overall profits should get a boost from higher-yielding loans. The company said the sale should close by the end of November. Information Holdinsg posts higher Q3 profit, rev (5:14 PM ET) SAN FRANCISCO (CBS.MW) -- Information Holdings IHI late Thursday reported third-quarter earnings of $2.5 million, or 12 cents per share, up from $1.2 million, or 6 cents per share, a year ago. Revenue for the quarter was $23.2 million, compared with $18.9 million in 2003. Overstock.com Q3 loss narrows (5:09 PM ET) SAN FRANCISCO (CBS.MW) -- Online discount retailer Overstock.com OSTK late Thursday said its third-quarter loss narrowed to $3 million, or 16 cents a share, from its loss of $3.72 million, or 23 cents a share, in the year-ago period. Revenue rose to $103.4 million from $57.8 million. Analysts polled by Thomson First Call were expecting a loss of 20 cents a share on $102 million in revenue. EMS Technologies forecast Q3 below Wall Street (5:07 PM ET) SAN FRANCISCO (CBS.MW) -- EMS Technologies ELMG warned late Thursday that third-quarter earnings will be lower than previously expected, citing weak orders in its wireless and satellite broadband units. The company forecast earnings of $600,000 to $900,000, or 5 cents to 8 cents per share, on revenue of $62 million to $64 million. Analysts surveyed by Thomson First Call estimate earnings of 20 cents per share, on revenue of $72 million. Leadis Technology Q3 revenue rises 83% (5:00 PM ET) SAN FRANCISCO (CBS.MW) -- Leadis Technology LDIS said after the bell Thursday that net income for the third quarter was $5 million, or 16 cents a share, compared with $4 million, or 17 cents a share, a year ago. Shares issued in the third-quarter increased to 30.6 million vs. 23.7 million a year earlier. The company said third-quarter pro forma income was $6.1 million, or 20 cents a share, vs. $4.2 million, or 18 cents a share, a year earlier. The semiconductor company said revenue for the quarter was $40.9 million, compared with $22.3 million a year ago. WebMethods Inc. narrows Q2 loss (4:59 PM ET) SAN FRANCISCO (CBS.MW) -- WebMethods Inc. WEBM late Thursday reported a fiscal second-quarter loss of $3.3 million, or 6 cents a share. Last year, it lost $4.5 million, or 9 cents a share. Sales were $51.2 million, up from $45.4 million a year ago. The business integration software company forecast 2004 revenue of $49 million to $53 million and pro forma earnings of 3 cents a share to a loss of 3 cents a share. AvalonBay Q3 earns slip but FFO rises (4:58 PM ET) SAN FRANCISCO (CBS.MW) -- AvalonBay Communities AVB said late Thursday that it earned $43.2 million, or 60 cents a share, in the third quarter, down from last year's level of $57.4 million, or 79 cents a share. Funds from operations came to 86 cents a share, up from 80 cents a share last year. Looking ahead, AvalonBay sees fourth-quarter earnings of 67 cents to 70 cents a share with funds from operations of 85 cents to 88 cents a share. Cohu swings to profit in Q3 (4:50 PM ET) SAN FRANCISCO (CBS.MW) -- Cohu Inc. COHU late Thursday reported third-quarter earnings of $5.2 million, or 24 cents per share. Last year, the company posted a loss of $615,000, or 3 cents per share. Revenue for the quarter was $55 million, compared with $34.5 million in 2003. Applied Films Q1 profit from ops declines (4:49 PM ET) SAN FRANCISCO (CBS.MW) -- Applied Films Corp. AFCO a maker of thin film deposition equipment for electronics companies, late Thursday said its fiscal first-quarter pro forma income from operations fell to $1.7 million, or 11 cents a share, from $2.9 million, or 25 cents a share, in the year-ago period. Revenue fell to $41.7 million from $47.7 million. Applied Films blamed the decline on the general slowdown in the flat panel display industry. Applied Films expects a fiscal second-quarter profit in the range of 4 cents a share to 7 cents a share, on revenue of $42 million to $44 million. Broadcom earnings climb on record sales (4:45 PM ET) WASHINGTON (CBS.MW) -- Broadcom on Thursday posted a big increase in third-quarter profit owing to higher sales of semiconductors used to power high-speed network devices such as modems, digital cable boxes and switches. The Irvine, Calif.-based company posted income of $49 million, or 14 cents a share, up from a loss of $6.3 million, or 2 cents, a year earlier. Excluding onetime gains and losses, the company said it earned 36 cents a share. That beat the 34-cent consensus of analysts surveyed by Thomson First Call. Revenue rose 51.9 percent to $646.5 million a year earlier, though it was only slightly above the prior quarter's mark. Google stock hits new high after Q3 report (4:44 PM ET) SAN FRANCISCO (CBS.MW) -- Google Inc. GOOG stock jumped to $155.25 in after-hours trading, setting a new high following the company's third-quarter report. The stock closed the regular session up $8.89 to $149.38. Leggett & Platt posts sharply higher Q3 profit (4:43 PM ET) SAN FRANCISCO (CBS.MW) -- Metal fixtures and furnishings manufacturer Leggett & Platt LEG announced after the closing bell Thursday third-quarter net earnings of $80.2 million, or 41 cents a share, up from $50.8 million, or 26 cents a share, a year ago. Revenue for the three months ended Sept. 30 totaled $1.34 billion, up from $1.16 billion. The results matched expectations of analysts polled by Thomson First Call. The company's stock rose 14 cents Thursday to close at $27.33 a share. Amazon Q3 profit disappoints (4:43 PM ET) CHICAGO (CBS.MW) -- Amazon.com Inc. AMZN said it made $54 million, or 13 cents a share in the third quarter, well ahead of last year's income of $16 million, or 4 cents a share. However, the results fell far short of the 18 cents a share average expectation of analysts reporting to Thomson First Call. Sales climbed to $1.46 billion from $1.13 billion a year ago. PeopleSoft moves into Q3 profit as sales rise (4:36 PM ET) LOS ANGELES (CBS.MW) -- PeopleSoft PSFT late Thursday posted a third-quarter profit of $23.6 million, or 6 cents per share, improving from a year-ago loss of $7.3 million, or 2 cents a share. Sales for the period rose nearly 12 percent to $698.8 million from $624.1 million. Excluding one-time items, the company earned $62 million, or 17 cents a share. Wall Street analysts had expected, on average, earnings of 14 cents a share on sales of $680.8 million, according to a Thomson First Call survey. The company has been battling a $7.7 billion hostile takeover attempt by rival Oracle ORCL for nearly 17 months. Compuware swings to profit in Q2 (4:34 PM ET) SAN FRANCISCO (CBS.MW) -- Compuware Corp. CPWR late Thursday reported second-quarter earnings of $7.4 million, or 2 cents per share. Last year, the company posted a loss of $8.5 million, or 2 cents per share. Revenue for the quarter was $295.5 million, compared with $302.8 million in 2003. McKesson profits slip 45%, sales up 19% (4:30 PM ET) WASHINGTON (CBS.MW) - McKesson MCK reported on Thursday a 45 percent drop in profits for its second fiscal quarter, down to $86 million, or 29 cents per share, from $157 million, or 53 cents per share, in the year-ago period. The firm's revenues jumped 19 percent to $19.9 billion from $16.8 billion a year ago. Analysts polled by Thomson's First Call had estimated third quarter earnings per share at 24 cents. Microchip earnings gain 67 percent on sales growth (4:30 PM ET) SAN FRANCISCO (CBS.MW) -- Microchip Technology Inc. MCHP said earnings rose 67 percent for its second fiscal quarter amid strong sales for the company's microcontroller product. Revenue for the period ended Sept. 30 was $220.7 million with earnings of $60.4 million, or 29 cents per share, compared to revenue of $168.5 million and earnings of $36.1 million, or 17 cents per share, for the same period last year. Earnings were in line with estimates by analysts, according to Thomson First Call. Correct: Xilinx Q2 earns 24c, sales $403 mln (4:27 PM ET) SAN FRANCISCO (CBS.MW) -- Xilinx XLNX reported fiscal second-quarter net income of $86 million, or 24 cents a share, on sales of $403 million. Analysts expected earnings of 24 cents a share on sales of $399 million, on average, according to Thomson First Call. (Corrects to reflect second quarter.) Coca-Cola earnings plunge 24 percent; revenues flat (4:27 PM ET) CHICAGO (CBS.MW) - Coca-Cola earned $935 million, or 39 cents per share, in the third quarter, down 24 percent from the $1.2 billion and 50 cents of the year ago period. Revenue came in flat at $5.7 billion on worldwide case volume growth of 1 percent. Shares of Coca-Cola KO added 3 cents to $39.48 Thursday Microsoft posts $2.9 billion Q1 net income (4:27 PM ET) SAN FRANCISCO (CBS.MW) -- Microsoft MSFT on Thursday reported a first-quarter net profit of $2.9 billion, or 27 cents a share, on $9.2 billion in revenue. The company said personal-computer sales and higher business demand spurred overall sales. During the same period a year ago, Microsoft earned $2.6 billion, or 24 cents a share, on $8.22 billion in revenue. Sigma-Alrich lifts Q3 earns 27%, reaffirms 2004 outlook (4:26 PM ET) SAN FRANCISCO (CBS.MW)-- Specialty chemicals maker Sigma-Aldrich SIAL reported Thursday third-quarter net earnings of $56.3 million, or 81 cents a share, up from $46.8 million, or 66 cents a share, a year ago. The results matched expectations of analysts surveyed by Thomson First Call. Revenue in the three months ended Sept. 30 totaled $340.6 million, up from $314.2 million. The company reiterated its earnings outlook of $3.30 to $3.35 a share for the full year. The company's stock closed Thursday up 7 cents at $55.99 a share. Celestica cuts losses; adjusted earnings beat estimates (4:24 PM ET) SAN FRANCISCO (CBS.MW) -- Celestica Inc. CLS trimmed its net losses for the third-quarter as revenue jumped 33 percent. Net loss for the quarter was $22.3 million, or 11 cents per share, on revenue of $2.18 billion compared to a net loss of $65 million, or 30 cents per share, on revenue of $1.64 billion for the same period last year. Excluding charges for restructuring, the company said it earned $27.4 million, or 11 cents a share, beating analysts forecasts of 8 cents per share, according to Thomson First Call. KLA-Tencor Q1 earns 58c, sales $519 mln (4:20 PM ET) SAN FRANCISCO (CBS.MW) -- KLA-Tencor KLAC reported fiscal first-quarter net income of $116 million, or 58 cents a share, on sales of $519 million. During the same quarter last year, KLA-Tencor earned $36.8 million, or 18 cents a share, on sales of $318 million. Analysts expected earnings of 57 cents a share and sales of $512 million, on average, according to Thomson First Call. Gilead Sciences Q3 profits up 55%, sales jump (4:19 PM ET) WASHINGTON (CBS.MW) - Gilead Sciences GILD reported on Thursday earnings of $113 million, or 25 cents per share, a 55% rise from $73 million, or 17 cents a share, a year earlier.
